Dans ce Tools In Action, au travers de diff√©rentes d√©monstrations, nous allons voir les possibilit√©s avanc√©es offertes par ces outils : comment d√©tecter et analyser les probl√®mes de performances, comment simuler d'autres environnements ou contextes (latences r√©seaux, probl√®mes d'accessibilit√©, etc.) ou encore d√©couvrir des fonctions tr√®s int√©ressantes pour am√©liorer ses d√©veloppements.

talk.summaryAsHtml:
Many large-scale enterprises still use homegrown solutions to deploy profilers sporadically for research and to gain short-term production performance insights. However, this has its limitations as profilers are often language-specific, come with substantial overhead, and provide limited ability to aggregate and analyze clusterwide data.

Production profiling has significantly improved today, and by leveraging tools like eBPF it‚Äôs now possible to have a better understanding of your clusterwide performance for cost optimization, as well as advanced segmentation and analysis. In this talk we walk you through the basics from how to use modern continuous profiling tools, how to read a flamegraph, and what to look for with a real-world demo in modern complex, microservices environments. It will continue to advanced profiling of cluster deployment, code performance profiling over time, and even how to provide feedback loops for developers to optimize performance from the foundations of their code.
talk.title: Into the flamegraph: From the primitives through advanced concepts

Le terme Micro-Frontends est apparu pour la premi√®re fois dans ThoughtWorks Technology Radar √† la fin de 2016. Il √©tend les concepts de micro-services au monde du FrontEnd.

Webpack est un modules bundler open source. Son objectif principal est de regrouper des fichiers JavaScript, HTML et CSS pour les utiliser dans un navigateur.

Dans sa version 5, Webpack apporte un nouveau plugin appel√© Module Federation, celui-ci permet d'assembler des fichiers et modules "distants", est-√†-dire expos√©s sur une autre machine.

Ce plugin ouvre les porte d'une nouvelle fa√ßon de r√©aliser des applications Micro-FrontEnds. Il permet ainsi de d√©couper, versionner, patcher et d√©ployer son application par "morceaux", afin de diminuer sa complexit√© globale et de faciliter ses √©volutions. L'aspect multi-frameworks permet quant √† lui de faciliter les migrations de stacks techniques en enlevant la contrainte d'une refonte globale r√©alis√©e d'un seul tenant.

talk.summaryAsHtml: Streaming comes at you fast, and the "faster" architectures powering it can be both painful to use and a pain to maintain. But how painful does it really have to be? Redpanda is a new storage engine that can be used as a drop-in replacement for Apache Kafka, built from the ground up for maximum performance and low operational overhead. When combined with Materialize, a streaming database for real-time analytics, it provides a robust, more accessible foundation to build streaming data pipelines. Too good to be true? Join us to see it for yourself as we walk you through a demo!
talk.title: Materialize+Redpanda: streaming for the rest of us
talk.summary:
Streaming comes at you fast, and the "faster" architectures powering it can be both painful to use and a pain to maintain. But how painful does it _really_ have to be?
[Redpanda](https://vectorized.io/) is a new storage engine that can be used as a drop-in replacement for Apache Kafka, built from the ground up for maximum performance and low operational overhead. When combined with [Materialize](https://materialize.com/), a streaming database for real-time analytics, it provides a robust, more accessible foundation to build streaming data pipelines. Too good to be true? Join us to see it for yourself as we walk you through a demo!
